Column Comment.0: LEASE OR UNIT IDENTIFIER: Number or code assigned as an alias that uniquelyidentifies a lease or unit for production monitoring and reporting purposes.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designate d as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: PROD LEASE UNIT ALIAS identifier: Unique Code identifying any other name theplu is known by.
Column Comment.3: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.4: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: PROD LEASE UNIT ALIAS: Code or name identifying any other name the plu isknown by.
Column Comment.7: REASON TYPE: The purpose or reason for a given alias. For example a facility aliasmay be assigned because of a name change.
Column Comment.8: SHORT NAME: A short name given to an alias.
Column Comment.9: ALIAS TYPE: The type of alias, such as partner, historical, records etc.
Column Comment.10: AMENDED DATE: the date on which a name has been ammended. Often, this isused for official or legal changes to a name.
Column Comment.11: CREATED DATE: The date on which the alias was first created. This date maypreceed the ammendment date, in the event that the ammended date refers to aformal registration event.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the alias became effective
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the alias is no longer valid.
Column Comment.14: LANGUAGE IDENTIFIER: The language of the alias.
Column Comment.15: ORIGINAL INDICATOR: A y/n flag indicating that this alias is the original one firstassigned to a business object.
Column Comment.16: ALIAS OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associatewho owns this alias.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this alias is a preferredname or code.
Column Comment.19: REASON DESCRIPTION: A narrative explanation about the alias being used.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: SOURCE DOCUMENT: References the document where this alias has been given.Documents may be published, internal references, journals etc.
Column Comment.22: STRUCK OFF DATE: Date on which the legal name was struck from corporateregistry and is no longer used.
Column Comment.23: SOFTWARE APPLICATION IDENTIFIER: The identifier for the application that ownsthis alias or code or that is used to apply the data in this row.
Column Comment.24: USE RULE: A narrative column that is used to describe the circumstances in whichthis alias is to be used.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
